assessment.complexityJustification: Requires significant architectural changes: Windows Service to Worker Service, MSMQ to Azure Service Bus/Queue Storage, legacy project format to SDK-style, and containerization

blockers.description: Application uses Windows Service infrastructure (ServiceBase, ServiceInstaller)
blockers.mitigation: Convert to .NET Worker Service using BackgroundService

blockers.description: Uses MSMQ (System.Messaging) which is Windows-only and not available in containers
blockers.mitigation: Replace with Azure Service Bus, Azure Queue Storage, or RabbitMQ

blockers.description: Legacy project format (not SDK-style) incompatible with modern .NET

opportunities.description: Simple, well-structured code with clear separation of concerns
No NuGet packages to upgrade or replace
Order processing logic is stateless and event-driven

risks.description: Fundamental shift from Windows Service to containerized Worker Service
risks.impact: Requires testing of service lifecycle and deployment procedures

risks.description: Moving from MSMQ to cloud-based queue requires data format compatibility
risks.impact: May need message translation or queue migration strategy

risks.description: Different monitoring, logging, and deployment patterns in Azure Container Apps
risks.impact: Team needs to learn new operational procedures

migrationPath.recommended: Incremental modernization with parallel operation period

phases.name: Architecture Migration
tasks: Convert Windows Service to Worker Service
Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus or Queue Storage

immediate: Set up Azure Service Bus namespace and queue for testing
Create a feature branch for modernization work
Document current MSMQ message format and processing logic
beforeMigration: Ensure comprehensive understanding of message processing requirements
Plan message queue transition strategy (parallel run vs cutover)
Set up Azure Container Apps test environment
duringMigration: Maintain backward compatibility with message format where possible
Implement robust error handling and retry logic
afterMigration: Monitor performance and error rates closely
Keep old Windows Service available for rollback
Document new deployment and operational procedures

upgradeAssistant.notes: Can help with initial project format conversion and framework upgrade

portabilityAnalyzer.notes: Will identify Windows-specific APIs that need replacement
